title: Ticket #4933: Condor_submit should allow -queue statement on command line
description:
condor_submit should accept the queue statement from the command line. This is especially useful if the new queue arguments from 8.3.5 are allowed.

To avoid confusion, a command line -queue statement will be allowed only if the submit file does not have a queue statement, and only one -queue command statement will be allowed.

Also -append "queue <args>" will be converted into -queue <args>.

syntax will be 

    condor_submit -queue <arguments>

where <arguments> can be any of the arguments that the Queue statement in the submit file accepts. In particular 

    condor_submit -queue FILE in *.dat

would be expected to expand on POSIX platforms to 

    condor_submit -queue FILE in a.dat b.dat c.dat ...

In support of this, -queue will consume arguments that follow it until the next -
